channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As U.S. foreign aid grants get slashed, Greenland gets money for a dog race
item.description: Second lady Usha Vance has scrapped a plan to attend Greenland's national dog sled race this week. But American tax dollars will help support the race anyway.
item.content:encoded:
Second lady Usha Vance has scrapped a plan to attend Greenland's national dog sled race this week. But American tax dollars will help support the race anyway.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Social Security officials partially walk back plans for in-person verification
item.description: Officials said they would now exempt people who apply for Medicare and disability benefits, as well as supplemental income help for the poor, from having to prove their identity in-person.
item.content:encoded:
Officials said they would now exempt people who apply for Medicare and disability benefits, as well as supplemental income help for the poor, from having to prove their identity in-person.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Appeals court sides with judge who blocked deportations under wartime authority
item.description: The D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals panel denied the Trump administration's push to restart deportations of alleged gang members under a rarely used wartime authority known as the Alien Enemies Act.
item.content:encoded:
The D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals panel denied the Trump administration's push to restart deportations of alleged gang members under a rarely used wartime authority known as the Alien Enemies Act.

(Image credit: Handout)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Trump announces new 25% tariff on imported cars and car parts
item.description: The president's latest action on trade takes effect next week, and will slap a 25% tariff on imported cars and car parts. He says the measure will boost U.S. manufacturing.
item.content:encoded:
The president's latest action on trade takes effect next week, and will slap a 25% tariff on imported cars and car parts. He says the measure will boost U.S. manufacturing.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Judge allows 'New York Times' copyright case against OpenAI to go forward
item.description: The legal fight could have far-reaching implications for the media and artificial intelligence industries.
item.content:encoded:
The legal fight could have far-reaching implications for the media and artificial intelligence industries.

(Image credit: Michael Dwyer)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: What to know about Pituffik, the only U.S. military base in Greenland
item.description: Vice President JD Vance will travel to Greenland this week, including a stop at Pituffik Space Base, the U.S. Defense Department's northernmost installation and its only outpost on the island.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President JD Vance will travel to Greenland this week, including a stop at Pituffik Space Base, the U.S. Defense Department's northernmost installation and its only outpost on the island.

(Image credit: Thomas Traasdahl)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: EV buyers who missed out on their tax credits now have a fix from the IRS
item.description: Some car owners couldn't claim the EV tax credit for vehicles purchased in 2024 because dealers skipped a key sales reporting step. The IRS is now offering a fix.
item.content:encoded:
Some car owners couldn't claim the EV tax credit for vehicles purchased in 2024 because dealers skipped a key sales reporting step. The IRS is now offering a fix.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Brazil's Supreme Court says Bolsonaro must stand trial over alleged coup attempt
item.description: The former far-right populist president, Jair Bolsonaro, will face trial for allegedly attempting to overturn his 2022 reelection loss and stage a violent coup.
item.content:encoded:
The former far-right populist president, Jair Bolsonaro, will face trial for allegedly attempting to overturn his 2022 reelection loss and stage a violent coup.

(Image credit: Ueslei Marcelino)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: The Global Race for Rare Earth Minerals
item.description: The race is on for control over deposits of rare earth elements and critical minerals that are necessary in much of the technology we use today. The U.S. is lagging behind it's main rival in this global competition, China. We hear about why these resources are so sought after and the stakes in the race to control them.
item.content:encoded: The race is on for control over deposits of rare earth elements and critical minerals that are necessary in much of the technology we use today. The U.S. is lagging behind it's main rival in this global competition, China. We hear about why these resources are so sought after and the stakes in the race to control them.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Federal judge who drew Trump's anger picks up new case against administration
item.description: James Boasberg, chief judge of the U.S. District Court in Washington, D.C., will preside over a case about the Trump administration's use of a Signal group chat to discuss military information.
item.content:encoded:
James Boasberg, chief judge of the U.S. District Court in Washington, D.C., will preside over a case about the Trump administration's use of a Signal group chat to discuss military information.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore
